intro: Phenax granulatus, commonly known as the granulate phenax, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky crevices. Its foliage is often covered in fine, granular bumps, giving it a unique texture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
